plant_001.name: African Violet (Saintpaulia ionantha)
plant_001.description: Compact African houseplant featuring velvety, deep‑green leaves and clusters of purple, pink, or white blooms that can appear year‑round indoors when given consistent warmth and humidity.
plant_001.water: Water when the top 2 cm of soil feels dry; keep evenly moist but not water‑logged.

plant_002.name: Aloe Vera
plant_002.description: Sun‑loving succulent prized for its thick, gel‑filled leaves used in skin care. Forms offsets at the base and thrives on benign neglect in bright windows.
plant_002.water: Allow soil to dry completely between waterings; water sparingly.

plant_003.name: Anthurium (Anthurium andraeanum)
plant_003.description: Tropical epiphyte grown for its glossy, heart‑shaped foliage and long‑lasting red, pink or white spathes that surround a yellow spadix; ideal for warm, humid rooms.
plant_003.water: Water when the top 2 cm of soil feels dry; keep evenly moist but not water‑logged.

plant_004.name: Areca Palm (Dypsis lutescens)
plant_004.description: Graceful, feathery palm with multiple cane‑like stems; an efficient natural air‑purifier that lends a tropical vibe to bright living spaces and is non‑toxic to pets.
plant_004.water: Water when the top 2 cm of soil feels dry; keep evenly moist but not water‑logged.
plant_004.light: Bright, indirect to direct light; some gentle sun tolerated.

plant_005.name: Asparagus Fern (Asparagus setaceus)
plant_005.description: Delicate, arching stems covered in fine, needle‑like cladodes give this fern‑look‑alike a soft texture; tolerates bright filtered light and occasional drying.
plant_005.water: Keep soil consistently moist; water when surface dries and maintain high humidity.
plant_005.light: Medium to bright, indirect light; avoid harsh sun.

plant_006.name: Begonia (Begonia spp.)
plant_006.description: Enormously diverse genus ranging from cane begonias with showy spotted leaves to wax begonias with masses of flowers; valued for both foliage patterns and blooms.
plant_006.water: Water when the top 2 cm of soil feels dry; keep evenly moist but not water‑logged.

plant_007.name: Bird of Paradise (Strelitzia reginae)
plant_007.description: Large, banana‑like leaves and bright orange‑and‑blue bird‑shaped flowers make this South African native a dramatic focal plant given ample light and space.
plant_007.water: Water when the top 2 cm of soil feels dry; keep evenly moist but not water‑logged.
plant_007.light: Bright, indirect to direct light; some gentle sun tolerated.

plant_008.name: Birds Nest Fern (Asplenium nidus)
plant_008.description: Broad, rippled fronds unfurl from a central rosette, creating a nest‑like crown; thrives in warm bathrooms with steady humidity and indirect light.
plant_008.water: Keep soil consistently moist; water when surface dries and maintain high humidity.
plant_008.light: Medium to bright, indirect light; avoid harsh sun.

plant_009.name: Boston Fern (Nephrolepis exaltata)
plant_009.description: Classic fern with arching, finely divided fronds; excellent in hanging baskets where consistent moisture and high humidity are available.
plant_009.water: Keep soil consistently moist; water when surface dries and maintain high humidity.
plant_009.light: Medium to bright, indirect light; avoid harsh sun.

plant_010.name: Calathea
plant_010.description: Prayer‑plant relative admired for striking leaf patterns that fold at night; appreciates warm, shaded conditions and fluoride‑free water.
plant_010.water: Water when the top 2 cm of soil feels dry; keep evenly moist but not water‑logged.

plant_011.name: Cast Iron Plant (Aspidistra elatior)
plant_011.description: Nearly indestructible, slow‑growing plant with leathery dark leaves that tolerates low light, temperature swings, and occasional neglect.
plant_011.water: Water when the top 2 cm of soil feels dry; keep evenly moist but not water‑logged.

plant_012.name: Chinese Money Plant (Pilea peperomioides)
plant_012.description: Charming, fast‑growing plant with round, coin‑shaped leaves on long petioles; easy to propagate from stem pups, hence nicknamed the friendship plant.
plant_012.water: Water when the top 2 cm of soil feels dry; keep evenly moist but not water‑logged.

plant_013.name: Chinese evergreen (Aglaonema)
plant_013.description: Shade‑tolerant foliage plant bearing lanceolate leaves marbled with silver, cream, or red; reliable even under fluorescent office lighting.
plant_013.water: Water when the top 2 cm of soil feels dry; keep evenly moist but not water‑logged.

plant_014.name: Christmas Cactus (Schlumbergera bridgesii)
plant_014.description: Long‑lived forest cactus that produces cascades of pink, red, or white tubular flowers around the holidays when given short‑day cues.
plant_014.water: Water when the top 2 cm of soil feels dry; keep evenly moist but not water‑logged.

plant_015.name: Chrysanthemum
plant_015.description: Herbaceous perennial producing dense pom‑pom, daisy, or spider‑type blooms in vivid hues; often sold as a seasonal indoor pot plant in autumn.
plant_015.water: Water when the top 2 cm of soil feels dry; keep evenly moist but not water‑logged.

plant_016.name: Ctenanthe
plant_016.description: Close Calathea relative with strikingly patterned, lance‑shaped leaves that move in response to day length; prefers evenly moist soil and dappled light.
plant_016.water: Water when the top 2 cm of soil feels dry; keep evenly moist but not water‑logged.

plant_017.name: Daffodils (Narcissus spp.)
plant_017.description: Early‑spring bulbs with cheerful, trumpet‑shaped yellow or white flowers; can be forced indoors for late‑winter color.
plant_017.water: Water when the top 2 cm of soil feels dry; keep evenly moist but not water‑logged.

plant_018.name: Dracaena
plant_018.description: Group of cane‑forming plants with strappy green or variegated leaves; excellent for filtering indoor air and tolerant of low‑to‑medium light.
plant_018.water: Water when the top 2 cm of soil feels dry; keep evenly moist but not water‑logged.

plant_019.name: Dumb Cane (Dieffenbachia spp.)
plant_019.description: Fast‑growing tropical with large, cream‑mottled leaves; sap can numb vocal cords if ingested, hence the common name.
plant_019.water: Water when the top 2 cm of soil feels dry; keep evenly moist but not water‑logged.

plant_020.name: Elephant Ear (Alocasia spp.)
plant_020.description: Dramatic statement plant sporting oversized, arrow or heart‑shaped leaves that lend a jungle feel; enjoys warmth and constant moisture.
plant_020.water: Water when the top 2 cm of soil feels dry; keep evenly moist but not water‑logged.

plant_021.name: English Ivy (Hedera helix)
plant_021.description: Trailing or climbing vine with lobed evergreen leaves; popular in topiaries and hanging baskets but needs cool conditions indoors.
plant_021.water: Water when the top 2 cm of soil feels dry; keep evenly moist but not water‑logged.

plant_022.name: Hyacinth (Hyacinthus orientalis)
plant_022.description: Fragrant spring bulb bearing dense spikes of pastel to deep‑hued flowers; bulbs can be chilled and forced for winter blooms.
plant_022.water: Water when the top 2 cm of soil feels dry; keep evenly moist but not water‑logged.

plant_023.name: Iron Cross begonia (Begonia masoniana)
plant_023.description: Unique begonia with puckered green leaves displaying a dark, cross‑shaped mark; prized for its foliage texture rather than flowers.
plant_023.water: Water when the top 2 cm of soil feels dry; keep evenly moist but not water‑logged.

plant_024.name: Jade plant (Crassula ovata)
plant_024.description: Tree‑like succulent with glossy, oval leaves that can blush red in strong light; regarded as a symbol of prosperity and good luck.
plant_024.water: Allow soil to dry completely between waterings; water sparingly.

plant_025.name: Kalanchoe
plant_025.description: Compact succulent topped with clusters of long‑lasting red, pink, yellow or orange blooms; commonly sold as a gift plant.
plant_025.water: Allow soil to dry completely between waterings; water sparingly.

plant_026.name: Lilium (Hemerocallis)
plant_026.description: Day‑lilies produce trumpet‑shaped flowers atop grassy foliage; each bloom lasts a day but plants rebloom generously in full sun.
plant_026.water: Water when the top 2 cm of soil feels dry; keep evenly moist but not water‑logged.

plant_027.name: Lily of the valley (Convallaria majalis)
plant_027.description: Sweetly scented woodland perennial that spreads by rhizomes, producing dainty white bell flowers beneath arching leaves.
plant_027.water: Water when the top 2 cm of soil feels dry; keep evenly moist but not water‑logged.

plant_028.name: Money Tree (Pachira aquatica)
plant_028.description: Often sold with braided trunks, this wetland tree forms palmate leaves and is believed in Feng Shui to attract wealth.
plant_028.water: Water when the top 2 cm of soil feels dry; keep evenly moist but not water‑logged.

plant_029.name: Monstera Deliciosa (Monstera deliciosa)
plant_029.description: Iconic large leaves develop natural splits and holes (fenestrations) as the plant matures; climbs with aerial roots in warm, bright rooms.
plant_029.water: Water when the top 2 cm of soil feels dry; keep evenly moist but not water‑logged.

plant_030.name: Orchid
plant_030.description: Epiphytic moth orchids (Phalaenopsis) are most common indoors, bearing elegant arching spikes of long‑lasting flowers in myriad colors.
plant_030.water: Water when the top 2 cm of soil feels dry; keep evenly moist but not water‑logged.

plant_031.name: Parlor Palm (Chamaedorea elegans)
plant_031.description: Compact, slow palm tolerant of low light and dry air, making it ideal for parlors and offices since Victorian times.
plant_031.water: Water when the top 2 cm of soil feels dry; keep evenly moist but not water‑logged.
plant_031.light: Bright, indirect to direct light; some gentle sun tolerated.

plant_032.name: Peace lily
plant_032.description: Glossy, deep‑green foliage and white hood‑like spathes that bloom even in medium light; top performer in NASA air‑cleaning study.
plant_032.water: Water when the top 2 cm of soil feels dry; keep evenly moist but not water‑logged.

plant_033.name: Poinsettia (Euphorbia pulcherrima)
plant_033.description: Holiday staple with brightly colored bracts (not petals) surrounding small yellow flowers; requires bright light and even moisture.
plant_033.water: Water when the top 2 cm of soil feels dry; keep evenly moist but not water‑logged.

plant_034.name: Polka Dot Plant (Hypoestes phyllostachya)
plant_034.description: Bushy houseplant with small leaves speckled pink, red or white; pinch tips regularly to keep compact.
plant_034.water: Water when the top 2 cm of soil feels dry; keep evenly moist but not water‑logged.

plant_035.name: Ponytail Palm (Beaucarnea recurvata)
plant_035.description: Not a true palm; woody caudex stores water at base while long strap‑like leaves cascade fountain‑style.
plant_035.water: Water when the top 2 cm of soil feels dry; keep evenly moist but not water‑logged.
plant_035.light: Bright, indirect to direct light; some gentle sun tolerated.

plant_036.name: Pothos (Ivy arum)
plant_036.description: Virtually indestructible climber displaying green, golden or variegated heart‑shaped leaves; thrives in water or soil.
plant_036.water: Water when the top 2 cm of soil feels dry; keep evenly moist but not water‑logged.

plant_037.name: Prayer Plant (Maranta leuconeura)
plant_037.description: Colorful patterned leaves lay flat by day and fold upright at night like praying hands; enjoys warm, humid shade.
plant_037.water: Water when the top 2 cm of soil feels dry; keep evenly moist but not water‑logged.

plant_038.name: Rattlesnake Plant (Calathea lancifolia)
plant_038.description: Long, wavy leaves with dark green ovals and maroon undersides resemble a rattlesnake’s pattern; appreciates constant moisture.
plant_038.water: Water when the top 2 cm of soil feels dry; keep evenly moist but not water‑logged.

plant_039.name: Rubber Plant (Ficus elastica)
plant_039.description: Bold, leathery leaves – green, burgundy or variegated – atop a single trunk; can grow into an indoor tree with bright light.
plant_039.water: Water when the top 2 cm of soil feels dry; keep evenly moist but not water‑logged.

plant_040.name: Sago Palm (Cycas revoluta)
plant_040.description: Ancient cycad with stiff, feather‑like fronds radiating from a woody crown; all parts are highly toxic if ingested.
plant_040.water: Water when the top 2 cm of soil feels dry; keep evenly moist but not water‑logged.
plant_040.light: Bright, indirect to direct light; some gentle sun tolerated.

plant_041.name: Schefflera
plant_041.description: Umbrella tree sports glossy leaflets in a whorl; fast grower that tolerates a range of indoor conditions.
plant_041.water: Water when the top 2 cm of soil feels dry; keep evenly moist but not water‑logged.

plant_042.name: Snake plant (Sanseviera)
plant_042.description: Upright sword leaves store water and tolerate deep shade or bright sun; releases oxygen at night making it good for bedrooms.
plant_042.water: Allow soil to dry completely between waterings; water sparingly.
plant_042.light: Low to bright, indirect light; very adaptable.

plant_043.name: Tradescantia
plant_043.description: Trailing stems bear purple‑tinted or silver‑striped leaves; fast and forgiving, ideal for hanging pots.
plant_043.water: Water when the top 2 cm of soil feels dry; keep evenly moist but not water‑logged.

plant_044.name: Tulip
plant_044.description: Classic spring bulb growing a single, cup‑shaped bloom per stem in an array of vivid colors; easily forced indoors.
plant_044.water: Water when the top 2 cm of soil feels dry; keep evenly moist but not water‑logged.

plant_045.name: Venus Flytrap
plant_045.description: Carnivorous bog plant whose hinged leaf traps snap shut on insects; needs distilled water and winter dormancy.
plant_045.water: Water when the top 2 cm of soil feels dry; keep evenly moist but not water‑logged.

plant_046.name: Yucca
plant_046.description: Desert plant with rigid, dagger‑like leaves atop a woody trunk; thrives in bright light and sparse watering.
plant_046.water: Water when the top 2 cm of soil feels dry; keep evenly moist but not water‑logged.
plant_046.light: Bright, indirect to direct light; some gentle sun tolerated.

plant_047.name: ZZ Plant (Zamioculcas zamiifolia)
plant_047.description: Architectural stems carry glossy leaflets that tolerate very low light and infrequent watering thanks to rhizome water storage.
plant_047.water: Water when the top 2 cm of soil feels dry; keep evenly moist but not water‑logged.
plant_047.light: Low to bright, indirect light; very adaptable.
